results.title: Emotional maturity
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
A docu-drama depicting the immature behaviour of an adolescent boy who fails to channel his emotions into positive feelings and actions. After being rejected by his girlfriend, Dave seeks revenge by slashing her new boyfriend’s tyres. Deeper investigation suggests that Dave’s parents have contributed to his ‘emotional instability’ by treating him like a child.

results.title: Emotional development: aggression
results.creator_credit: Barbara Jampel, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Aggression is one of the least understood emotions. This film looks at the ways it is leant, when it is used and how aggressive skills are maintained. Alternatives to aggression such as co-operation and negotiation are also examined.

results.title: Emotional aspects of pregnancy
results.creator_credit: Sally Marschall, Phillip Koch and Joshua Productions
results.brief_description: Prepares the expectant mother and father for emotional changes, highlighting the experiences of two expectant couples and of one single expectant mother. During pregnancy, the woman’s feelings become more intense. The man’s feelings change also. Relationships with family and friends take on new dimensions. Both need reassurance that they are loved.

results.title: Emotional and social development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Discusses Erikson’s eight stages of development looking at the first two stages of trust versus mistrust and autonomy versus shame and doubt as applying to infants. A newborn baby moves through a development process to become a social being. Focuses on critical periods in development such as stranger anxiety, attachment, separation anxiety and preparation-individuation.

results.title: Emotion
results.creator_credit: Robert Aller and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
What exactly are emotions, and why do they have the power to dictate our lives? The first part of this program discusses the question of whether there are emotional responses common to and recognisable by all cultures, or whether culture plays a significant role in how emotion is expressed. There seem to be three consideration when studying emotion: what your body does, what your mind does and what you have learnt to do, and the latter part of the program looks at anger and anxiety in particular and how these powerful emotions can be used or controlled with these three considerations in mind.

results.title: Emoh ruo
results.creator_credit: Denny Lawrence, David Elfick, Palm Beach Pictures and UAA Films
results.brief_description: Australian satire about the Tunkley family and the trouble they encounter when they buy their first home. Stars Joy Smithers and Martin Sacks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denny Lawrence, David Elfick, Palm Beach Pictures and UAA Films

results.title: Emmet Otter's jug-band Christmas
results.brief_description: Emmet Otter and his mother Alice both enter a talent contest in an effort to win $50 and buy each other the ‘best’ Christmas present. Entering involve sacrifices, pawning their departed father’s tool kit and drilling a hole in Alice’s washboard to make a musical instrument. Both Alice and Emmet perform well but not good enough to beat the out of town contestants,’The Riverbottom Nightmares’. Initially it seems that their efforts have been futile but when they combine their talents they discover that they have the best Christmas ever. Based on the book by Russell and Lillian Hoban.
